thread.title: Steelers placekicker Josh Scobee should start dusting off his resume
thread.title_full: Steelers placekicker Josh Scobee should start dusting off his resume | OregonLive.com

author: Geoffrey C. Arnold | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Steelers placekicker Josh Scobee should start dusting off his resume
text:
Josh Scobee said he wanted to redeem himself. He probably won't get another opportunity with the Pittsburgh Steelers .
The placekicker missed two important field goals in the fourth quarter of the Steelers 23-20 loss in overtime to the Baltimore Ravens Thursday night.
Pittsburgh coach Mike Tomlin, with no confidence in Scobee during the overtime period, opted to try and convert a fourth-and-one situation from the Baltimore 39 instead of attempting a field goal. The Steelers failed on the attempt and the Ravens regained possession and eventually kicked the game-winning field goal.
"I wanted to redeem myself, but I didn't get it,"Scobee told reporters after the game. "I feel like I let the team down. It's a bad feeling."
Scobee did convert on two field goals earlier in the game, but the misses in the fourth quarter prevented the Steelers from adding to their lead.
Tomlin said the coaching staff will "have to turn the stones over" in an effort to win games.
That's not a good sign for Scobee, who was acquired in a trade with Jacksonville after longtime kicker Shaun Suisham suffered a season-ending knee injury during the Hall of Fame game in August.
There are plenty of unemployed placekickers available in the NFL. It's likely the Steelers will start holding auditions in the coming days.
"I can't think about that stuff," Scobee said. "I just have to let it play out."
-- Geoffrey C. Arnold | @geoffreyCarnold
